subject: Education
title: Critical Periods: Windows That Close
description: Learn Critical Periods: Windows That Close in one minute.

hook.text: If a child doesn't hear language by age 5, they may never learn to speak fluently. The window closes permanently.

buildup.text: Critical periods are time windows when the brain is primed to learn specific skills â€” vision, language, attachment.

discovery.text: Nobel Prize research showed kittens blindfolded during their visual critical period became permanently blind in one eye.

twist.text: Genie, a girl isolated until age 13, never fully acquired grammar despite years of therapy. The window had closed.

climax.text: Critical periods prove that timing matters as much as teaching. The right input at the wrong time can't undo missed

punchline.text: The brain doesn't wait forever. Some lessons have an expiration date.

quiz.question: What are critical periods in brain development?
options: Time windows when the brain is primed to learn specific skills
